sentence.idiomatic: Instant noodles don't have any nutrition, you had better eat less of them.
Excessive dieting will result in malnutrition.
Mom's cooking is both tasty and nutritious.
Kid, you really cause a lot of worry.
This is my matter, you don't need to worry about it.
He has his own views--don't go to any pains over him.
Don't make a fool out of me.
She's been on a diet lately. Every day an apple serves as her lunch.
He treats his girlfriend like she is a princess.
At first, I didn't like him, but a minor matter changed my view of him.
Originally, he was very fat--now he's gotten slimmer.
We originally lived in Beijing. Later, we moved to Shanghai.
How can you play computer games all day long?
Don't believe what he says. He talks big all day long.
The child has been crying all day, what should I do?
This pizza looks really tempting.
The price of that notebook computer is really enticing.
This kind of flower isn't brightly colored, nor does it have an attractive fragrance--however, its value in medicinal use is very precious.
Seeing so many good things to eat, he couldn't stop greedily salivating.
I've honestly never seen a person as gluttonous as you before.
She is especially greedy when it comes to food--as soon as she sees something tasty, she wants to eat it.
He is really a playboy--he has a whole load of girlfriends.
I'm sorry, today I have a huge pile of work to do. I don't have time to go with you to see a movie.
Grandfather especially dotes on his grandson. He bought him a huge pile of toys.
What are you eating?
Beef jerky. It's spicy, and especially good. You want a piece?
No. When it comes to snacks, I like potato chips and chocolate.
Those are junk food. They're high in calories.
Those duck necks and chicken feet you like to eat aren't so great for you either.
Ah, you just don't understand. Those things are quite nutritious. Also melon seeds and pickled plums. They're all delicious and healthy too.
Healthy? Eating snacks is not going to be healthy. It's better to eat less of them.
You don't need to worry about that. I won't make a meal out of them. Snacks are for munching on when you're bored.
So how come I see you eating them all day long?

Geez, these days snack ads and packaging are so enticing, as soon as I see them I get the munchies. Every time I go to the grocery store, even though I'm not planning to buy them, I still end up with a whole pile of them. And if I buy them of course I'm going to eat them.
You're such a pig.
